modules.description: This module generates Graphviz DOT representations of OCaml values, visualizing memory structures as directed graphs. It works with lists of labeled memory cells, using configuration options to customize graph appearance such as node colors and layout direction. Concrete use cases include debugging complex data structures by producing visual graphs that can be rendered with Graphviz tools.

This module provides functions to inspect and manipulate the memory layout of OCaml values by converting them into explicit block representations. It works with low-level data types such as `block`, `pblock`, and `addr` to model memory addresses, pointers, and closures. Concrete use cases include analyzing pointer relationships in memory, tracking shared values, and visualizing the internal structure of closures and data blocks.

This module visualizes and analyzes the memory layout of OCaml values by converting them into directed graphs or explicit block representations. It operates on low-level memory constructs such as blocks, pointers, and addresses, allowing inspection of pointer relationships and closure structures. Users can generate customizable Graphviz DOT files to render memory graphs, track shared values, or examine the internal composition of data structures. Example uses include debugging complex heap layouts and analyzing closure environments.
